definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: storm, rage (Ecclus. [[סער]] Hiph. Sir 47:17; move tempestuously; [[סְעָרָה]] storm-wind Sir 43:17 Sir 48:9; NH Pi. stir up, blow, [[סְעָרָה]] storm-wind; = II. [[שָׂעַר]], but relation obscure; As. šâru, wind, favours originality of ´[[שׂ]], but this only late in Heb., and for ´[[ס]] Frä:189 cp. Ar. sa9ara kindle fire, excite, inflame, be vehemently hungry and thirsty, be mad, insane, etc. Lane:1363);—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Impf. 3 mpl. fig., [[יִסְעֲרוּ]] Hb Hab 3:14 they [my foes] storm along to scatter me; Pt. act. [[סׂעֵר]] Jon 1:11 the sea was growing more and more stormy, so v:Jon 1:13 (+ [[עֲלֵיהֶם]]); f. [[סׂעֲרָה]] Is 54:11 storm-tossed (fig. of Jerusalem).

definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Impf. 3 ms. [[וַיִּסָּעֵר]] 2Ki 6:11 and the heart of the king…was enraged because of ([[עַל־]]) this thing.

definitions.title: Pi.
definitions.body: Impf. 1 S. sf. [[וְאֵסָֽעֲרֵם עַל־]] Zec 7:14 (on form v. Ges:§§ 23 h, 52 n) and storm them away (hurl them by a storm-wind) upon the nations.

definitions.title: Po.
definitions.body: Impf. 3 ms. [[כְּמׂץ יְסׂעֵר]] Ho 13:3 shall be like chaff (which) is storm-driven from a threshing-floor.
